title: Thames & Kosmos Motors & Generators Science Kit | 25 Guided STEM Experiment Lessons | 48 Page Color Student Guide | Grades 3-6 | Ages 8+ | Play & Learn | Parents' Choice Silver Award Winner
descriptions:
Thames & Kosmos Motors & Generators Science Kit

What it is:
- A hands-on science kit that shows how simple motors and generators work.
- Made for children ages 8 and up (grades 3–6), but easy for grandparents to enjoy together with kids.
- Winner of the Parents’ Choice Silver Award.

What you do with it:
- Follow 25 step-by-step, guided experiments.
- Use a clear, see-through motor so you can watch parts move.
- Run the motor with batteries, or change it into a hand-crank generator to make your own electricity.
- Try simple activities with magnets, circuits, gears, and drive-trains.

What comes in the box:
- A sturdy motor with transparent plastic housing.
- Parts to reconfigure it into a small generator.
- A full-color 48-page student guide, plus a 60-page manual with clear pictures and simple instructions.

What kids learn:
- How a motor turns electricity into motion.
- How a generator turns motion into electricity.
- How magnetic fields and electric current are connected.
- Basic STEM skills: building, observing, and understanding cause and effect.

Why grandparents like it:
- Easy, picture-led steps; you don’t need to be “techy.”
- Short, manageable experiments that fit into a visit or an afternoon.
- Encourages curious questions and shared discovery time.
- Lightweight and tidy: about 13 inches tall, 9 inches wide, 3 inches deep, and just 1.3 pounds.

Helpful tips:
- Use fresh AA batteries for the motor activities (batteries may not be included).
- Clear a small table, follow one experiment at a time, and keep the small parts in a bowl.
- If a step seems confusing, look at the pictures—the guides are full color and easy to follow.

In short: This is a friendly, award-winning kit that lets you and your grandchild see electricity and motion in action. It’s simple to set up, fun to try, and a great way to learn together.
